intro: Diplazium atrosquamosum, commonly known as the black-squamated water fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Blechnaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds that are typically dark green with a slightly curled appearance. The plant produces sporangia on the underside of its fronds, which are clustered in small, spathulate structures called sorus. Diplazium atrosquamosum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important component of tropical and subtropical ecosystems.
